oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Experiences of Veterinarians Using Acupuncture on Farm Animals
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Trei, Gerriet
Brandt, Benjamin
Hörning, Bernhard
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Production systems
Health and welfare
Animal husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aim of this study was to collect information about experiences of veterinarians with acupuncture. 27 German veterinarians who regularly used acupuncture on farm animals were interviewed. Most vets had received special training in acupuncture. This treatment method was most often used on horses, followed by cattle (mainly dairy cows). It was especially applied against common diseases which could easily be cured. Treatment costs were higher for horses than for cattle. There has been an increased demand for acupuncture mainly for horses.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Trei, Gerriet; Brandt, Benjamin and Hörning, Bernhard (2008) Experiences of Veterinarians Using Acupuncture on Farm Animals. Poster at: Cultivating the Future Based on Science: 2nd Conference of the International Society of Organic Agriculture Research ISOFAR, Modena, Italy, June 18-20, 2008.
